metadata.title: CVE-2023-29405 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
The go command may execute arbitrary code at build time when using cgo.This may occur when running "go get" on a malicious module, or when runningany other command which builds untrusted code. This is can by triggered bylinker flags, specified via a "#cgo LDFLAGS" directive. Flags containingembedded spaces are mishandled, allowing disallowed flags to be smuggledthrough the LDFLAGS sanitization by including them in the argument ofanother flag. This only affects usage of the gccgo compiler.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29405` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.17 - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
golang-1.17-go - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
golang-1.17-src - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

golang-1.18 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1.2
golang-1.18-go - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1.2
golang-1.18-src - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2').
golang-1.18 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu1.2').
golang-1.20 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
